findings.title: Potential DoS in IndexRouter::mintSwap()
findings.description: The current implementation of `mintSwap()` has a potential denial-of-service issue due to a malicious actor intentionally donating a tiny amount of `_inputToken`, rendering the `mintSwap()` routine non-functional.

findings.title: Revisited creator Field in OrderDetails
findings.description: The `Phuture` protocol has a core `Orderer` contract that contains logic for order creation and execution, as well as reweigh execution. Each order contains an order details structure with the associated assets list, the creator address, as well as the creation timestamp and asset details. Our analysis shows that the creator address is not properly recorded when the order is created.

findings.title: Improved Logic in Orderer::externalSwap()
findings.description: The transfer function does not follow the ERC-20 standard and may cause issues if not handled properly, also the unsafe version of approve()/transferFrom() is used.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: Privileged manager account (with the `ASSET_MANAGER_ROLE`) plays a critical role in governing and regulating system-wide operations. The privileged functions in the `IndexRegistry` contract allow for configuration of risk parameters as well as addition/removal of supported assets.

findings.title: Suggested Constant Use in IndexRouter
findings.description: It is suggested to declare state variables as `immutable` or `constant` in the `IndexRouter` contract for gas efficiency and improved coding practices.
